Physical Exam Constitutional: He appears well-developed and well-nourished. HENT: Head: Normocephalic and atraumatic. Right Ear: External ear normal. Left Ear: External ear normal. Nose: Nose normal. Mouth/Throat: Uvula is midline and mucous membranes are normal. Uvula swelling present. Oropharyngeal exudate and posterior oropharyngeal edema present. Eyes: Conjunctivae are normal. Pupils are equal, round, and reactive to light. Neck: Normal range of motion. Neck supple. Cardiovascular: Regular rhythm. Pulmonary/Chest: Effort normal. Vitals reviewed.

item.paragraph:
Subjective:
Patient ID: Test Zzzaffiliatesonly is a 40 y.o. male.
HPI
Sore Throat
Location: generalized
Quality: sore and burning Severity: is severe
Onset quality: gradual
Duration: 1 week
Frequency: occurs constantly
Progression since onset: gradually worsening
Chronicity: new
Relieved by : cold liquids and gargle
Worsened by: coughing and talking
Ineffective treatment: acetaminophen and mist
Associated symptoms: sinus congestion, rhinorrhea and cough. Negative for abdominal pain, drooling, neck stiffness, oral lesion, ear pain, eye discharge, postnasal drip, trouble swallowing, arthralgia, adenopathy, chest pain, fatigue, rash, voice change, chills, fever, shortness of breath and headaches
Risk factors: exposure to illness
ROS

Negative for: Constitutional, Gastrointestinal, Neurological, Skin, Genitourinary, Musculoskeletal, Endocrine, Cardiovascular, Eyes, Respiratory, Psychiatric, Allergic/Imm, Heme/Lymph
Objective:
Physical Exam
Constitutional: He appears well-developed and well-nourished.
HENT:
Head: Normocephalic and atraumatic.
Right Ear: External ear normal.
Left Ear: External ear normal.
Nose: Nose normal.
Mouth/Throat: Uvula is midline and mucous membranes are normal. Uvula swelling present. Oropharyngeal exudate and posterior oropharyngeal edema present.
Eyes: Conjunctivae are normal. Pupils are equal, round, and reactive to light.
Neck: Normal range of motion. Neck supple.
Cardiovascular: Regular rhythm.
